oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Temperance Election of March 11, 1907, ladies singing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "48. Ladies singing in north precinct of the Ninth ward. This ward, claimed by the wets, gave a dry majority of 203. It is the home of many working men and was one of three wards to vote over 1,000." Scenes from Knoxville's Great Temperance Election of March 11th, 1907. Jas. E. Thompson, Photographer. From the Abby Crawford Milton Collection. Shows crowd with flags waiting near returns sign.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Political elections; Events; Temperance; Women's rights; Flags;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jas. E. Thompson, Knoxville, TN.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
